[h1]My CS:GO review.[/h1]
The game is really good, it's very [b]skill-based[/b] and that drives me to play for [b]hours and hours[/b], feels like there's no [b]skill cap[/b] - with enough time you can achieve [b]anything[/b]. The one [b]problem[/b] is the [b]anticheat[/b], free cheats are [b]available[/b] and people who don't want to put [b]time[/b] into this game download them and [b]destroy you[/b]. Valorant has a [b]good anticheat[/b], but it doesn't give me what CS:GO [b]gives[/b]. My rating: 7/10.

I've owned the game for 5 years, back when you had to pay for it. Granted I did not put alot of time into the game until recently, the game is still very active and fun.... Unless you run into hackers, which can be hard to tell apart from just good players because some of these guys make love to the game everyday. Besides that aspect the game is very fun with friends winning or losing as long as its not by some hacker carrying the team with over 35 kills and 110 score.
